abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Education Sector
            Development Project for Lesotho are as follows: outcomes of
            the project were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, bank performance was
            satisfactory, and borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: use of
            implementation arrangements outside of the public service
            structures created difficulties of sustainability. Despite
            the intentions at appraisal, the Project Support and
            Coordination Unit (PSCU) became the de facto implementing
            agency for the project and for other Ministry of Education
            and Training (MoET) functions. Once established, it was
            allowed to grow rapidly. While effective in implementing the
            core tasks, the PSCU did little to build capacity within the
            ministry. In fact, any failures in the ministry were seen as
            strengthening the case for continuation of the PSCU. The
            reluctance to address this issue on time, and to develop a
            realistic transition strategy, has resulted in a much more
            abrupt transition than would otherwise have been the case,
            with consequent disruption to the work of the MoET. Building
            capacity within the MoET remains a challenge. Provision of
            training courses has had some impact, but the benefits were
            eroded by staff turnover and by organizational structures
            which prevented optimal use of the skilled personnel.
            Building better organizational structures is likely to take
            some time, and some external assistance may be required to
            ensure efficient operation of the MoET. However, future
            external assistance should be carefully managed to ensure
            that it supports capacity building aims and cannot become a
            separate arm of the ministry.
